RelatedSentence: The report shows that the youth who were incarcerated in adult facilities in DC were disproportionately young men of color from low - income communities .
According to the report , most of the time that youth spend at the adult jail is prior to trial , when youth are presumed innocent of the offense .
The adult system is no place for kids , said Carmen Daugherty , CFYJ Policy Director .

Trying youth as adults also jeopardizes public safety as there is no evidence that adult court deters youth crime in general and compelling evidence that it actually increases recidivism among those who are processed through it .

Judges should play a role in reviewing both the alleged facts of the case and the facts of the child to determine whether the youth and public safety would be better served by the rehabilitative goals and services of the juvenile justice system .

DCLY seeks to improve the DC juvenile justice system by advocating for reforms that promote positive youth development , effective legal representation , and supportive relationships between the community and DC 's youth .
